physical_appearance: The image shows a rectangular photograph that is in black-and-white. The photograph features three adult males and one female child. They are all sitting down on a raised platform. There are musical instruments as well as microphone stands with them. The heads of several people can be seen facing the direction of the raised platform. The background of the photograph contains some pictures that are framed. One of the pictures is that of a Hindu deity. The background of the photograph suggests that this was taken in the interior of a theatre.
sgcool_label_text: Mr. S Gopalakrishnan (b. in 1920 in Tanjavur) was a prominent violinist, and Carnatic singer. He arrived in Singapore in 1939 and actively participated in the Indian classical music scene here. Mr Gopalakrishnan performed alongside veterans of classical performers such as Pandit M Ramalingam and MV Gurusamy at temple and other music festivals. He also taught violin lessons at the Singapore Malayalee Association from the 1970s to 2000s. He was a member of the Tamils Reform Association and performed his wedding according to the principles of the Self-Respect Movement. He was also employed as a compositor at the Far East Air Force from 1954 to 1970.
title_text: MV Gurusamy and S Gopalakrishnan with his daughter Selvi (7 years old) singing at the Tank Road Temple
